page.title: 07TEST SITE, SWADLINCOTE
page.content: {Swadlincote test site}is part of the {N.C.B. Mining Research & Development {Establishment.}It was opened in 1956 to carry out surface testing of mining machinery. The site covers{80 acres}& approximately{120 people}are employed there.In 1981 a large complex of test houses was opened to allow most machinery to be tested inside. Tests are usually carried out before the machinery is used in any one of the present coal mines in Great Britain. Machines are often tested to destruction. This is done on purpose to find out how much a machine can take before it breaks down.
